reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: nice and polite hotel staff. The hotel has good facilities (mini golf, pedalboats etc) with a nice red sea beach. The food in the restaurents was nice but the same every day. The drinks in the all-inclusive offer was not that good. The wine and drinks are all very sweet and artificial tasting. Here are our ltop 3-list of the best drinks in the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, friendly staff, poor drinks

reviews.text: 1. Gin fizz - allmost like a gin and lemon
reviews.title: Wouldn't go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Sunrise - sweet drink with lemonade, not real orange juice!
reviews.title: My mistake

reviews.text: 3. For the meal - pick white wine. Not so sweet like the red and the rose.
reviews.title: Stunning, Simply Stunning.

reviews.text: Regarding the rooms. The room was really nice but the 'service of the room' was not. We did'nt get any new towels or shampoo, toiletpaper - we had to steal this in the evening.
reviews.title: Good experience, Great for kids, friendly staff, No Union Jack shorts.
5 star
reviews.text: We recently returned from a week at the dana beach and woud say it was probably our best holiday yet. If you want to relax and not have to worry about anything, this is the place for you.

reviews.title: lovely complex made to feel very welcome but surprised by the winds ..
reviews.text: The food was very good for an all inclusive buffet. There were a variety of choices, generally fish, chicken, beef as well as vegetarian options and salads. If you like deserts there are a good ten choices each meal time.

reviews.title: Great hotel, would definately return!!
reviews.text: The alcoholic drinks were good, beers, gin, vodka, rum, whisky, and brandy were available plus coctails withtin the AI option. The bar men were very helpful often topping up your drinks for you.

reviews.title: excellent for relaxation!!!
reviews.text: The resort itself is very big with apartment blocks located around a man made lagoon stretching approx 1/3 mile long. At the end of the lagoon is the beach which is private and has many sun beds to choose from. The sea is shallow up to the pier but then still not that deep. If you like snorkling then the are a few spots of coral with a variety of fish just off the pier.

reviews.title: Just like butlins, NOT!!!!!!
reviews.text: Even though it is the sort of place you would not venture away from unless doing a tour or diving trip this place has much to keep you entertained. There is beach volleyball, boccia, tennis, football, crazy golf, darts, water aerobics, belly dancing, yoga mostly in the day time. On the lagoon you can hop on a pedalo or rowing boat to get from the main hotel to the beach or vice versa. There is also a power boat every 15 mins if you are feeling lazy.

I have just come back from The Dana Beach hotel. The hotel is located away from downtown Hurghada about 15 mins from the aiport. The hotel is huge, and has a more village feel than hotel with everything spaced out, and kept immaculate. The rooms are ok, we were in block 5000 which was ideal, half way to reception and half way to the beach, and right opposite the island restaurant and bars.
reviews.title: Village feel rather than hotel..

reviews.text: The hotel has a large lagoon which you can hire pedlos and go around. There are several resturants, although the food was very much the same in each resturant. The service was good. There are 3 pools although sorry to say we didnt actually venture in as we stayed on the beach everyday.
reviews.title: Great value and fabulous for families
Honest review with some useful tips! This hotel LOVE the English!
reviews.text: There is a lovely spa in which the prices are very reasonable.. but do haggle the price they will drop it.. can reccomend the cleopatra 90 min treatment!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are some gift shops opposite the hotel, downtown hurghada is about 15 mins away, and teh hotel offer a very good taxi service which we used, they will drop you off and pick you up. We ventured out to the marina, where there is a Hed Kandi and Ministry of Sound Nightclub both were excellent or tough a little quiet at this time of year..
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel in a Fabulous Country

reviews.text: We didnt really stay around for the entertainment so i cant really comment on that. There is a dive school, and watersports centre both reasonable prices. There are lots of excursions on offer. We went to Luxor and cairo for the day, both amazing, but a recomendation, do the trip to Luxor by bus as you get to see the real egypt along the nile, but do the trip to Cairo by plane as its a very long journey by bus through the desert with not much to see.
reviews.title: Good choice, clean, safe and good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned from this hotel and it was a pleasant experience. The hotel is advertised as a 5*, I would say it is more a 4*. I had booked a suite and was given a family room (2 bedrooms, one with a double bed and the other with 2 single beds), this was not what I booked so I spoke to reception, who slightly reluctantly gave us another room, which was in the 3100's which is just off the beach. The location within this complex was perfect for us as we spent our time on the beach and not by the pools and it was quieter. The room was much larger and more like a 4.5* hotel than the other much smaller rooms.
reviews.title: The Dana Beach needs more UK guests

reviews.text: I didnt really like the food, I am a fussy eater and it wasn't really to my taste, they cater for the vast majority of guests who tend to be German. However, my husband thought it was quite good, just very repetitive. The good thing is neither of us were ill,which surprised me as I witnessed so many people using the bathrooms and not washing their hands after going to the toilet. I cannot understand how people can think it is ok not to wash or to just run your hands under water after you have been ... it is not! This is how people become ill and blame it on the food.
reviews.title: wouldn't go back to this hotel if it was free!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is directly on the beach and has good facilities, though the beach itself was a disappointment. The hotel is in a bay and this area is not as nice as others further down the coast. The people who come and try and sell you trips and massages are very annoying and far too frequent.
reviews.title: 4* food, 3* accomodation, 2* drinks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel entertainment is very poor, though from speaking to people staying at other hotels in the area, this appeared to be the case at most hotels in the area.
reviews.title: OK But NOT 5 Star

reviews.text: The staff all spoke very good German and everytime a member of staff spoke to me they spoke in german, but when I told them I was English, they were pleased to have English people there and many couldnt do enough for us.
reviews.title: Very Large Resort, no need to leave !
